There is one other letter to him on a similar theme, Sen. xvi. 6, in which Petrarch gives an account of the encouragement he ⁴ had himself received in his studies as a youth from gne Giovanni da j Firenze.

The story here related of the old man of Perugia refers to Petrarch’s visit to Naples and Rome for his coronation in 1341. One of the early lives , of Petrarch(by Lelio de’ Leli) says this old man was Stramazzo da Perugia, who wrote a sonnet to Petrarch. But Petrarch’s reply, Rime xxiv, was written some years before 1341, so that this identification seems impossible. ‚
